summary: Internal FBI email chain from October 2021 discussing efforts to compile and share documents related to the Epstein/Maxwell case, specifically victim and attorney communications, in response to a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO). The emails focus on accessing and exporting an 'Epstein folder' from an FBI mailbox and identifying which Victim Specialists (VS) assisted specific victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the case and document retrieval request; his name is in the email subject line and referenced throughout the chain.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-defendant in the case; her name is paired with Epstein in the email subject line.

connections.description: Referenced together as the subjects of the FBI's document compilation and victim outreach efforts.

events.title: Request for Victim Specialist Information
events.description: An FBI agent requests help compiling an accurate list of victims and the Victim Specialists (VS) who assisted them, as well as all email contacts to victims and their attorneys.

events.title: Request to Export Epstein Folder
events.description: An FBI agent requests that a colleague export the 'Epstein folder' from the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox to a data file, zip it, and send it, as the USAO is requesting all email communication with victims.

events.title: Update on Export Process
events.description: A Victim Outreach Support analyst notes the export process must be done on-site and provides a timeline for completion.

events.title: Password Shared for Documents
events.description: An FBI agent shares a password ('SunSh!ne$5') presumably to access the requested documents related to Epstein/Maxwell.

events.title: Access Issues and Document Sharing
events.description: Multiple FBI agents exchange emails about difficulties accessing the Epstein/Maxwell documents, sharing alternative links, and confirming receipt.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) requested all FBI email communication with victims and their attorneys related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The FBI's Victim Services Division maintained an 'Epstein folder' in a shared mailbox containing victim and attorney communications.
There was an internal effort to identify which specific FBI Victim Specialists (VS) worked with which victims, using case numbers and victim notification letters.
The email chain reveals procedural steps and access issues within the FBI as they compiled documents for the prosecution.
All sender and recipient names in the email chain are redacted, indicated by placeholders like '(VSD) (FBI)' or '(NY) (FBI)'.
